alert.note: Alert for Muskogee; Okmulgee (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 24 at 12:46PM CDT until May 25 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of east central Oklahoma and northeast Oklahoma, including the following counties, in east central Oklahoma, Muskogee. In northeast Oklahoma, Okmulgee, Rogers, Tulsa, Wagoner and Washington OK. * WHEN...Until 400 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1246 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Tulsa... Broken Arrow... Claremore... Okmulgee... Owasso... Bixby... Jenks... Glenpool... Coweta... Skiatook... Catoosa... Collinsville... Verdigris... Haskell... Inola... Morris... Sperry... Oologah... Porter... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
